definition: to split/to crack/to break open/to rend

sentences.english: I applied a poultice and the abscess opened and began to heal.
sentences.chinese: 我敷上膏药，脓疮迸裂，开始痊愈。

sentences.english: Zhou Yu cried out, and his wound reopened.
sentences.chinese: 周瑜大叫一声，金疮迸裂。

sentences.english: He fell from the bridge and dashed his brains out on the rocks below.
sentences.chinese: 他从大桥掉下来，在下面的岩石上撞得脑浆迸裂而死。

sentences.english: The long winters have torn holes the size of sinks into the asphalt.
sentences.chinese: 漫长的冬季已经让迸裂的水池槽涂上了沥青。

sentences.english: His proud heart was nearly bursting.
sentences.chinese: 他那颗高傲的心几乎要迸裂了。

definition: to rupture/to burst open/to break up
(of droplets, sparks etc) to fly about in all directions/to splatter everywhere
to disintegrate/to shatter into small pieces
to destroy in an explosion/to break (by bombing)
all split up and in pieces (idiom); disunity (in an organization)/complete lack of unity/to disintegrate/falling apart/to be at sixes and sevens
loudly/with a loud bang/a loud rumble
